poem:
"Dancing with the Climate Titan"

Playing politics with our shared home,
like juggling fire in a sea of petrol, oh so bold.
No alternative, no choice but action, a clarion sings alone,
Cutting Greenhouse's ties, warming turns cold.
In this play of power, let the climate not be the pawn,
Seek wider benefits, gains not in gold.
Weave the world better, for life's dawn.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "‘No alternative’: EU climate chief urges MEPs not to use crisis as political tool Europe’s climate chief has warned against politicians trying to use the climate crisis as a wedge issue in the forthcoming EU parliament elections, calling instead for climate policy that will bring wider economic benefits. Wopke Hoekstra, the EU commissioner for climate action, said Europe had no choice but to press ahead with strong measures to cut greenhouse gases, whoever was in". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
